result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Deshawn Jackson

defendant.name: Jackson, Deangelo Deshawn
defendant.address: 3001 West Silver Spring Drive #303, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo Deshawn Jackson in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Deangelo Deshawn Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNT 1 
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERS THE FOLLOWING:
* Pay Fine in the amount of $250.00 PLUS costs, fees and  surcharges. Payable in 1 YEAR or Civil Judgment.
* Defendant to provide DNA specimen and pay DNA surcharge.
* Restitution set at ZERO.
* Court makes defendant eligible for expungement upon completion. 
* Appellate Rights given.

Defendant Deangelo Deshawn Jackson in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Deangelo Deshawn Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Deshawn Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Deangelo Deshawn Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date to follow 21CM2934. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Deshawn Jackson in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deangelo Deshawn Jackson appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Attorney John Krejci recently appointed and was not opted in and does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/6/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Deangelo Deshawn Jackson in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/4/22 @ 1p
